website_summaries.verdict: Easy to use, with a great antique/farmhouse look, but make sure you use a coarse grind with it.
pros: Made from a rugged Ball jar and a fine mesh filter of  stainless steel
cons: Filter may let some residue through (how much depends on your grind)
Some of these arrive with lids that won't seal tightly

customer_reviews.title: Good design, sort of...
customer_reviews.text: It uses 6 oz. of grounds (max) to make 32-40 oz. of coffee. Jar is 64 oz. capacity, but grounds take a lot of room. Design is great. I love the filter basket, but it is not big enough. I use twice as much grounds to make the same quart of coffee, and mine is concentrated - 1 part coffee with 2 parts water makes a cup of regular coffee. This just won't give me what I need, so I'll go back to using nut milk bags in a pitcher of water. A little more messy, but worth it. Buy this if you just want regular coffee cold brewed, but if you're looking for something stronger, find another way.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality and simple to use for great cold brew coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this filter for a few days now and made a few batches of cold brew coffee. The filter and silicone seals have a very durable feel to them and has been very easy to empty and clean in between batches. The bottle and brewing inserts arrived in perfect condition and were well protected in the box. The included manual has some nice basic tips as well as recipes for coffee drinks. I highly suggest buying an additional 2 Quart mason jar or 2 as I did to have an additional jar brewing while enjoying your current brew.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Thrasher

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Durability Issues
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great and makes great cold brew. I liked it so much, that I immediately purchased another Mason Jar, so I can have a new jar brewing before finishing the last. However, having only purchased the product less than four months ago, I'm finding that the lip of the filter screen (the part the rests on the rim of the Mason jar) has begun separating from the conical screen itself. Obviously, I expected better durability than this. If I get a seller response from this review, I will update it accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Glassner

customer_reviews.title: First time
customer_reviews.text: wasn't sure how much coffee to actually use so I winged it the first time using a little more than 1 cup of coffee to a full jar of water. Let it steep for about 24 hrs and although I do add milk in my coffee, I did not add a lot and the color was much lighter than I would usually drink it but the flavor was much stronger than it appeared, pleasantly surprised. So far, so good. Didn't want a complicated machine which is why I decided on this brewer, not disappointed at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jill523

customer_reviews.title: Filter hh was not soldered.  How could they miss that??!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product so I bought another one so I could have 2 jars going at once. Continuous coffee! I opened it and the filter and the filter rim was separated. It was not correctly soldered together. And the lid sealer was not included. Disappointed this was poorly made and not checked before they packed their product. Now gotta pack it up and ship it back :/. Will try another since i Mbnoy sure about the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes yes yes!!!
customer_reviews.text: My coffee preference is iced coffee after spending $3 a day at Dunkin Donuts I decided to order this product. Wow that's all I can say it's absolutely amazing I can make my coffee tastes just like the iced coffee at the high end coffee shops. I will say this it recommends leaving it set on the counter for 24 to 48 hours I believe the longer you leave it the better the quality is.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor, easy to use, saves me tons of money
customer_reviews.text: I work IT and am somewhat of a coffee snob. I can safely say that i have stopped buying expensive Vietnamese iced coffee because of this purchase and actually use Folgers when making coffee. That is really saying something because i would rather dump a fresh (hot) pot of Folgers out than drink it. I save on average 50$ a week. The flavor is great and if you don't cut the cold brew with water it is ridiculously strong. i highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: David Colburn

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective & makes a lot coffee that lasts
customer_reviews.text: Love Cold Brew coffee, but not the prices typically found at most market places. So I invested in this fine piece of equipment a few months back and have been making my own ever since. Easy to set up, filters coffee perfect if you follow instructions. Tips: Coarse ground coffee works best. Grind beans if yourself for best taste (less bitter). Single origin beans to help zero in taste prefence Steep 24 hours (+/- 8hrs) Stick with dark roast beans (more taste profile) Southern African & American beans produce tend to be better tasting
customer_reviews.author: Jonny S

customer_reviews.title: Found a solution
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this product, I liked the big jar size and the steady filter but I felt that it produced weak coffee. Now I have found a solution. I bought a Glass 2 Quart Mason Jar Pitcher by the same company. When I cold brew coffee, I just pour both ground coffee and water into the mason Jar without a filter. In this way, coffee and water mixed thoroughly producing strong coffee. After 24 hours, I put the filter into the pitcher and pour the coffee and water mix into the pitcher through the filter. When done, store cold brew coffee in a fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great kit but room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: For the cost and simplicity of this kit it's difficult to find anything better, in fact if you're spending more than $30 you're probably over-paying. For everything this kit gives you, it really only lacks a proper lid. After my first use the lid on this jar seemed like it didn't want to stay on after a wash and rinse. The cap and threading are not the best and lacks some required space to fit the gaskets for the filter and lid to stay on securely. Best advice is to not lift this up by the cap and neck and instead grab the entire jar to prevent accidentally dropping it.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Pleased that it met expectations
customer_reviews.text: My adult son and I are both hooked on this. The coffee isn't bitter and I find it handy to just make my coffee the day before and have it ready in the morning. Make sure you buy or grind it COURSE GROUND or you will have sludge in the bottom that sifts through the cone. I was surprised at the amount of coffee needed to fill the cone, but it does make it strong so you can always dilute it. Lastly, I like the low-tech/unplugged nature of it... It'll be great for my campervan as well.
customer_reviews.author: Travel Light

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The filter needs to be a finer mesh, as it allows coffee grounds through. Also, I was very disappointed that after only 4 or 5 uses, the filter separated from the metal ring that's around the top of it. I have since purchased a KitchenAid cold brew coffee maker, and while considerably more expensive, I have been much happier with it compared to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Have broken two cold brewers in the last ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy! Have broken two cold brewers in the last year and was looking for something that could handle the dishwasher. Not only that it looks really cute in the fridge! Been using this for two weeks now and do NOT see what other reviewers mean about filter being sharp? Super smooth, easy to rinse out and can go in dishwasher if I do not feel like a hand wash. This was a fantastic purchase for me. I bought the plastic lid with a pour spot so I can pour directly from the container. Fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: KBThomas

customer_reviews.title: No plastic, easy to use, but I have to use AeroPress to filter out fines & bitterness.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to make larger quantity of cold brew than I can with my AeroPress and chose this because it is glass and metal and no plastic. It is simple to use and clean, but the metal filter doesn't deliver the quality I get with the AeroPress .... thus, I am using my AeroPress as a filter/funnel! One little paper filter for AeroPress can be rinsed and reused multiple times (approx 20). If my stomach could handle the "before" product, my eco-conscience would be happier, the coffee is so much better filtered. The difference is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: T. H. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Good brewer make sure your careful when cleaning the strainer
customer_reviews.text: I received the brewer without directions unfortunately but when I contacted the company they were quick to respond and emailed me the directions pamphlet. I found the brewer is easy to use. At first I was confused with the extra plastic lining but its there for when you removed the strainer and youre only storing it, it keeps it nice and sealed. Im still messing with the recipe but it's been good. Only complaint is cleaning the metal strainer is a little challenging, sometimes it really tends to hold onto the coffee grinds. Over all I'm pleased with this company and the brewer.
customer_reviews.author: lacey kane

customer_reviews.title: This is really wonderful! The filter is perfect and won't let any ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really wonderful! The filter is perfect and won't let any grounds through, especially with the well thought out seals. Comes with great instructions that have variations based on how you're making and drinking your coffee (how long you're going to brew and if you're drinking it black or diluting it with milk or something else) and has instructions for loose leaf tea. I would definitely consider buying a second one so I could have tea and coffee going at the same time; I've never tried cold brewing tea before, and I'm excited to try it out and see how it tastes.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon F.

customer_reviews.title: good so far, but filter is getting dirty
customer_reviews.text: nice convenient way to make iced coffee- and has a cute rustic look with the whole mason jar trend. the jar is thick glass and the filter is metal. so far it has held up perfectly- and it's been 5 months. my only complaint is that the filter itself and the silicon/rubber seal the goes between the filter and the lid both seem to be getting stained from the coffee. I tried using some stainless steel cleaning chemical and it helped a little bit, but it matches a lot of the other pictures on here. the taste hasn't been affected at all though, so I still give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: M Howard

customer_reviews.title: Freaking awesome if you like heart palpitations!
customer_reviews.text: So I like this device a lot, but be forewarned—this makes super concentrated cold brew coffee. Seriously, this should come with a warning label. My advice is fill the jar with water after you take the coffee grounds holder out. It will still be very very strong and keep you up for days. Also cold brew isn’t the same as coffee. No complexity. I recommend buying just cheap regular coffee because you will use A LOT of coffee beans if you use this device all summer. Fancy coffee is a waste when it comes to cold brews. Also do the planet a favor and buy shade grown coffee to help preserve important habitat. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: A virtually fool-proof way to make the best cup of cold brew you've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I got hooked on cold brew (which is much different from iced coffee) last summer. But at over $5 at Starbucks I knew I couldn't sustain the habit. I found this system on Amazon and was drawn to the simplicity of it. And it truly delivers! Fill up the strainer with coffee (I like Bizzy, also found on Amazon, which is specifically ground for cold brew), and wait 12-18 hours (18 is ideal). I'd recommend the two-quart jar, as the coffee stays fresh for up to two weeks in the fridge. I've made this countless times and have yet to mess up a batch. The coffee is smooth, non-bitter and gives me sustained energy. Cannot recommend this highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Great Company and Brewer!
customer_reviews.text: Got the cold brewer and just set it up to brew my first batch in the refrigerator. The one star is because I did not get the seal in my box that is referenced on the included instructions to use when you are not brewing. I will revise my review when the missing item is received. Update: They very quickly sent the missing part. I love this brewer-makes terrific coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! I love the shape of the mesh filter allowing coffee and water to come in contact throughout the whole jar. The 2 quart jar is the perfect size for a batch of cold brew that will last a few days. My husband loves having his coffee ready and waiting every morning. The only negative is that I do find I need to be careful shaking the jar as the lid can leak a little bit, so I just place my hand over the lid and shake over the sink, not a big deal but worth mentioning. Overall really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases on amazon! Update: now have Two
customer_reviews.text: I come from the great Northwest were coffee is a religion, or seems so. now I live in a hot , humid climate and this wonderful brew jar delivers all it says and more. Sturdy and well designed always delivers my cold brew for such a reasonable price. I love strong brew and so smooth. Thank you ! We now have two, use both with different blends and strengths of coffee. Completely addictive. My husband and I plan to make a special brew in pretty gift size jars for Christmas gifts around the office. Likely be a cold brew brigade by January.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I love cold-brewed coffee. I had cold-brewed coffee without anything like this, but it was a long process that included many grounds at the end despite filtering. This system is easy to use. Even works with regular grind coffee; I noted very few left-over grounds from my first batch. This isn't as strong as what I had brewed myself, so I mix it more 50/50 than 64/33. I poured the brewed coffee into 2 glass jars that fit in my frig better and I'm now ready to start my second batch. Also will go in dishwasher easily and is not going to break easily. I highly recommend this system!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Fisher

customer_reviews.title: simple easy durable cold coffee brewer
customer_reviews.text: I have several different cold coffee brewers. the ones with pretty glass, that look like wine decanters, are only delicate, but difficult to get inside of them to clean. I suppose it would be easier with a brush. This design, using a wide mouth mason jar is the most practical. Not only because the container is easy to buy, but also it's durability, wide mouth for ease of cleaning, and ability to make a much larger quantity at one time. True it's not as decorative on the kitchen counter, but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: John Kitakis

customer_reviews.title: I fit in better at the skate park and have started my own ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about a week or so ago and the first day I got it I excitedly filled it with grounds and placed it in the fridge as instructed. However I did notice around day 2 that I started growing a gnarly mustache and could literally only wear flannel shirts out of the house with a beanie and my Jeans fit much tighter now, I also cant stop smoking American Spirit cigarettes. This filter/coffee maker has literally changed my life, I fit in better at the skate park and have started my own indie rock band.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho377

customer_reviews.title: Stop drinking peasant coffee and buy this cold brew set to improve your life
customer_reviews.text: Before this product I was just an average person drinking filthy peasant coffee. Now I get to enjoy delicious silky smooth java fit for royalty everyday. Joking aside - This cold brew set worked fantastically. This product was my introduction to homemade cold brew and it is phenomenal. The included instructions are well written and easy to understand and the entire set up process takes less than minutes. I just finished brewing my second batch and I have nothing but positive comments to report about the taste and how easy it was to make.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to clean and set up
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used this coffee maker once, but it performed perfectly! It is easy to clean and set up, loads easily, and sits quietly and "does it's thing" making a nearly two quart cold brew coffee concentrate. I followed the directions, and the first batch was perfect for my taste. I mixed the concentrate about evenly with ice. Both ice cubes and chips worked fine in my initial tests. I tend to wait until I've used a product like this for a week or two before I write a review, but my schedule is interesting right now and the product was flawless as long as I read and followed the directions!
customer_reviews.author: PatP

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Components
customer_reviews.text: County Line Kitchen took the lowly mason jar and added high quality components to create a simple cold brew coffee maker. The real secret is the sturdy, tightly woven metallic filter that does not let coffee grinds escape (and those silicon seals really work, too). The genius is in its simplicity. Follow their instructions (put coarse ground coffee in the filter, then pour in the water, then shake a couple of times over the next 12 hrs) and you get perfect cold-brewed coffee. Note to County Line Kitchen: Please make one of these filters for a Cuisinart 12-drip coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Great product that produces a great tasting cold coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This cold brew coffee maker is outstanding! Screen cleans easy and the lid and seals seem to be pretty good. I can see maybe needing to replace the seals sometime in the future, but that is to be expected. I used already ground coffee as my first trial and it only leaves a very small amount of fine silt in the bottom. Not enough to worry about or affect the taste in my opinion. Coarse ground coffee is recommended and I think will make an even better cold brew. I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with this product. It indeed makes cold brew coffee well. You have to adjust the formula to your liking based on the brand of coffee and the strength you enjoy. Be sure to grind your own beans quite coursely. I just think it is a bit overpriced. After receiving I realized that all I really needed was the filter to add to a jar that I already had. I later found basically the same setup for a third of the price. But that's ok. I use the product and it's produced by a small company in the USA so glad to support them.
customer_reviews.author: joan humphreys

customer_reviews.title: We would give this six stars if we could!
customer_reviews.text: We would give this six stars if we could! My brother loves cold brewed coffee and has been making it at home using either cheesecloth or, on occasion, the Starbucks packs. I got these for him for Christmas. Since he has to have decaf, these stainless steel filters allow him to buy coffee locally, grind his own beans, and brew his own - at a fraction of the cost for the non-decaf Starbucks and with far less muss and fuss (cheesecloth and grounds all over the kitchen). He only wishes they came in a two quart size!
customer_reviews.author: heyjude

customer_reviews.title: It works well and the coffee does taste good. The only reason I didn't give it 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased after having a friend rave about cold brewed coffee. It works well and the coffee does taste good. The only reason I didn't give it 5 starts is the amount of coffee that it takes to make a good strong batch and the screen is difficult to clean. To get the best flavor grind your own beans and fill the screen container to 1/2" from the top, I like it better left on the counter for 24 hours, it doesn't seem to get quite as strong if you put it in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: GrannyLulu

customer_reviews.title: Cold brew genius
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes making cold brew so crazy easy. If you like cold brew, you need this gadget. I used to put the coffee in the water and then filter it out after the over night brewing process like some kind of animal. Don't do that. Don't be an animal. Use this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie H Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I feel like mine is defective. Idk if anyone else has this problem but my lid doesn't screw on all the way. It just keeps going, and then when i think its screwed on, it pops up randomly. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Tkeb

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and cleans up well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my brother who had been making his own concoction, just putting raw grounds in water, and using a sieve, and then paper towels to filter out the grounds. He just called me and he loves this! He said that the shape of the filter is such that the grounds just come right out and there's hardly any coffee residue. He left it in the fridge for about 15 hours or so, and it was great. He was very excited that he can remove the grounds so easily, and that he isn't going to be spending so much time on it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thurman

customer_reviews.title: convenient and good-tasting, helpful company!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this thing regularly and am a huge fan. It's simple, tasty, etc. I do 'course ground' at the grocery store and bring the grounds bags back to reuse. I tend to leave it at room temperature for 24hrs then take out the coffee and fridge it, generally mixing 50/50 of the concentrated coffee with almond milk. Also, I somehow lost my filter seal and their website was sold out of replacements, so I emailed them and for free in a few days I had replacement filter seals!
customer_reviews.author: Takifugu

customer_reviews.title: Makes good cold brew
customer_reviews.text: It makes good cold brew over night in the fridge. However, the lid doesn’t screw on top with the gasket. I had to remove it in order to keep the lid on. Washing the filter is time consuming. If I were buying again I’d probably take a closer look at others.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Smooooooth coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love cold brew and this is a much more cost efficient way to enjoy it than going to Starbucks. Insert filter into jar, Add one cup of coffee to the filter, fill with water, then let it sit in the fridge for at least 24 hours ( I sometimes leave mine in for a few days, which does not create a bitter taste). After that time, remove filter, top jar off with water, and enjoy super smooth coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Anna K.

customer_reviews.title: Makes amazing cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: The coffee tastes amazing, and is way cheaper than Starbucks cold brew! I would definitely buy this product again, but the great thing is that the metal brewer fits into the standard 2-quart mason jar, so you can simply buy more jars and then have a steady supply of delicious cold brew! One thing that should be noted is that if you use finer ground coffee beans, then some of them will leak through the brewer and into the cold brew. Not a huge deal, or a problem with this product, mainly just a note to buy coarser ground coffee beans.
customer_reviews.author: D. Buxman

customer_reviews.title: Great product for cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: Why spend needless money on some fancy cold brewer that holds half as much brew as this one? Given how fast my cold brew coffee disappears I'd say this is the perfect brewer. How simple can you get! Just a large sturdy glass jar and a wire mesh filter. The only caveat I can come up with is that its a bit difficult to clean inside that long narrow filter - find yourself a long narrow brush. I've spent lots of dollars on various coffee brewers over the years, and none has been better spent than on this simple cold brewer.
customer_reviews.author: David B Englund

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean, makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I only gave 4 stars for one reason. When you have filter in, the top doesn't fully engage and will actually skip a thread if you over tighten. This makes it hard to properly tighten and results in it often leaking in the fridge. And for those of you that have one, yes I made sure the lid gasket was properly oriented. Great product and I'll probably buy a smaller one and I would recommend to buy for everyone, just a little complaint about the lid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bougher

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this cold brew set up is efficient and effortless. I was surprised by how easy to use and clean it is. Read a lot of reviews and decided to try something straight forward. I happened to already have a bunch of half gallon ball jars, so I'm able to have a system of continuous cold brew by starting the next batch as soon as the previous is done brewing. Makes nice smooth cold brew with the cheap Kirkland decaf I use. I'm curious to try it with better beans!
customer_reviews.author: M. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to make coffee in this. But what I love even more is the complete lack of bitter taste in the first sip. No bitterness at all. Very smooth. The only thing I don't like is the sediment the filter leaves. Just recently I started filtering it through a paper coffee filter in a funnel, and, while doing this, I transfer it into two smaller glass milk bottles that take up a little less room in my fridge. Win-win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Winter

customer_reviews.title: First-time making cold brew, and it turned out great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Bought coarse ground, dark roast coffee, brewed on the kitchen counter overnight. The concentrated coffee was ready to drink the next morning. We like our coffee with milk, so we put some coffee in each mug, added some milk until the mix was the color of our normal coffee, and heated the mugs in the microwave. The result was delicious! Excellent taste without any bitterness. Very easy to clean. Highly recommended. We are getting rid of our one-cup brewer.
customer_reviews.author: Executive and Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Cold Brew coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This ingenious systems makes it easy to brew cold brew coffee in your fridge. It's extremely easy to use. Just pop the screen into the jar, pour in your coffee, and add water. Leave it a couple of days in the fridge and enjoy. The jar is very nice and fits perfectly in the door of my fridge. It's not too big so it doesn't take up a lot of room. I also purchased the Flip Cap lid (3 pack) from the same seller. These are brilliant. So easy to pour straight from the jar!
customer_reviews.author: DSB

customer_reviews.title: Please redesign the lid!
customer_reviews.text: I am torn between how many stars. 1. Coffee taste is worth five stars. Enjoy a cup every morning! 2. Making the coffee is easy peasy. Five stars. Now the ugh. 1.The lid is totally wrong. Will not tighten enough and then just spins off only to be tighten again. You are afraid to pick it up. Both during the brewing and afterwards. One star 2. Then the silcone ring for the jar falls off into the jar. One star. I am going to buy a pitcher to pour the coffee in once brewed. And place a large rubber band around jar to help with gripping and picking up.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Paine

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this and plan to buy another one soon! Well made and durable and makes great, smooth coffee. The picture shows the gasket separate from the filter cone, but mine had it attached to the top, which I like. I suspect the gasket would get lost in my kitchen pretty quickly if separate. We have made great coffee just using regular grounds and are looking forward to making loose leaf iced tea soon.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Mom

customer_reviews.title: BEST EASIEST CHEAPEST Brewer EVER
customer_reviews.text: This works way better than I expected it would. I love it so much I bought another for my brother for Christmas. The cylinder is a little hard to clean but if I let the grounds dry in the cylinder in the sink it's a little easier to clean. I brew on my counter in 24 hours. A 2 Quart Mason Jar lasts me for about 5 days. I pour 8oz in a 24oz reusable cup and fill with ice. Saves money and the environment from plastic cups and straws. No throw away straws here!!! Buy this you will NOT be Sorry I promise!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Keddy

customer_reviews.title: Simple Solution
customer_reviews.text: Best product for the person getting started in making cold brew at home! Super easy to use and clean. My recommendation would be to fill the filter with 1.5c of stone street coarse ground beans (add16 crushed pods of cardamom and 2 split cinnamon sticks for an amazing extra flavor) and fill the entire ball jar—slowly—with cold water. Let sit for at least 12 hours. Then delic brew!! All you need is one extra empty 64 oz jar to fill up so you can repeat the process and store your current brew. This item is a simple solution to a problem!
customer_reviews.author: Ilana Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy filter and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: I left it on the counter for 12 hours, then in the fridge for a little over a day. The coffee seemed a little weak after diluting 1:1 with water, so next time I'm going to leave it in a little longer. Also, I might not have shaken the bottle enough after I added the water. Overall, I like the durability of the kit. The filter seems very sturdy. I will either invest in a brush for it, or just rinse it with water only. The last time, I just rinsed it with water and it seems just fine that way.
customer_reviews.author: Gelman

customer_reviews.title: Good filter, good jar, bad jar lid
customer_reviews.text: If you have an option to buy just the filter, do that. The one piece top doesn’t seal and cannot be held by it when screwed on. It’s a bit better when the filter isn’t in, but that’s 50% of the time. It’s just not worth the hassle. I ended up buying a new 2 quart mason jar with the traditional two-piece top from Target for like $6 and continue to use the filter with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa P.

customer_reviews.title: Broken filter
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I first got my coffee maker in the mail but to my surprise, the filter was broken at the top! I wasn't sure if it was supposed to be like that so I continued to make coffee and I ended up with unfilted coffee water. 🙁 I'll happily change my review if I receive a new filter but until then I'm not happy with my broken product.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio C

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make cold brew, iced coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a system that allows me to make my cold brew ice coffee easily! Southerners love their sweet tea and those of us in the north have the same love of iced coffee. The directions for the system were easy to understand and the process went smoothly. There was a little "sludge" on the bottom of the jar when I transferred it to the storage container but compared to the other ways I had been trying not much at all. I particularly like that I can take the main cold brew and depending on what strength I want add water. My guests will appreciate that they can have a stronger or weaker cup of coffee made to their liking!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie S.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Have other cold brew systems. This looks better, works better and WAY easier to clean. Will be getting more for X-mas gifts. The stainless steel cone is very well made. Could not find a wire sticking out anywhere on it. One recommendation. Provide an extra for both silicone seals. If i lose one, not sure how long it would take to replace? Don't spend money on gimmicks. Cold brew is coffee grounds soaking in water. Not making rocket fuel here. I wanted something that was easy to clean and would not take up a lot of space in the fridge. This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Appleton

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee u will ever try!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I have owned it for 1.5 now and definitely no complaints. Yes the seal has a tear in it but it still works. Kinda hard to complain about a little seal. Definitely makes the best coffee I have ever had. Starbucks has nothing on this. Even with cheap coffee it taste great!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: Makes excelent cold brew
customer_reviews.text: I prefer using glass to brew and store my cold brew coffee. This kit includes a second gasket to store brewed coffee in the 2qt mason jar. Fill up the heavy duty mesh filter about 2" from the top, fill with cool tap or bottled water toss in the fridge for 48 hours and enjoy. If you wish to filter ive noticed that brown natural filters work much faster than the cheap white one and remove all visible sediment from brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Large Cold Brewer!
customer_reviews.text: We went back and forth trying to decide on a cold brewer and finally decided on this product. It has not disappointed! The filter is awesome - just be mindful of your hands along the seam, it can be a bit sharp. Instructions are very clear, and the size is great! If you're looking for a large volume cold brewer, this is an excellent choice. Since it is large, it does take quite a bit of coffee grounds to fill, but we've played around with using less grounds and brewing the coffee for longer which has worked well. This is a fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Lokster27

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Cold Brewer
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic cold brewer. Some of the features that sold me on it were its good size; reusable, sturdy metal mesh filter; and ease of cleaning with all parts being dishwasher safe. What else can I say other than it does what it's supposed to do and is easy to clean and use again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: The Cold Brew system brews a smooth coffee
customer_reviews.text: I am fully satisfied with the Country Line cold brew system. It is very easy to use and very easy to clean. Most importantly the coffee tastes really good . I don't like bitter or acidic coffee and this coffee is smooth. I used to buy cold brew in a jar but I was spending too much. I feel this is saving me money although I haven't worked out how much yet. The filter is very fine but substantially made and does not leak coffee grounds I have served it to my son and he agreed that it is a good tasting brew.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with the purchase. It's easy to use and easy to store in the fridge. I've made 2 batches so far and the taste of the cold brew is great. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is that, If the mesh can be doubled or even finer that will be even better. I did try to grind my bean as coarse as possible, but often there are still fine residue that cannot be filtered completely, so I need to filter it again after i pour the brew out. Other than that, I find this very wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: C Shieh

customer_reviews.title: Great cold brewer!
customer_reviews.text: Loving my cold Brewer! I love cold brew coffee in The summer time but it's gets so expensive buying those cold brew packs that only make a quart of 2 at a time. I've made a couple jars so far and the taste is much better and lasts longer! I can control the brew strength, love that fact. Very easy to clean, so glad I finally purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica V.

customer_reviews.title: Dig it.
customer_reviews.text: I've only made a couple of batches of cold brew thus far but everything worked great both times. Standard type mason jar but the strainer/filter seems to be made well and the silicone seals are a good fit. Definitely recommended. UPDATE: The regular lid sucks and they want $8 for the pour spout lid which is a complete ripoff. Save yourself some money and get the flip top lid to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Smoooooth & Easy
customer_reviews.text: My BRIM cold brew developed a leak, so I got this to replace it. Cold Brew could not be easier and is so smooth and easy drinking - YES, you can tell the difference between this and the BRIM. Cleanup could not be easier - just pull the cone out and turn it upside down in the garbage can - 99% of the grounds fall out immediately, and the rinse is simple. Get it NOW and Enjoy your Cold Brew
customer_reviews.author: BryanFromJersey

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Seals at the top are a little unusual to align
customer_reviews.text: This system works great. There are two rubber seals. I have tried using one and both. Sometimes they are a bit hard to align, but this is a minor issue. Under some circumstances, it can leak a bit when you shake it. In general no issues however, and the filter itself is surprisingly fine and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. This has made making cold brew coffee a very easy process. I highly recommend this product if you normally make cold brew coffee in a container and then have to strain it using a cheese cloth or coffee filters...such a slow and tedious process this former method is. Now with this new product I don't get as much cold brew coffee as I use to but that is okay because its simple to strain (pull out the mess strainer and you are done) it makes making smaller batches a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: OhanaMama

customer_reviews.title: The lid is cheap.
customer_reviews.text: The jar and strainer are good quality, of course it's hard to go wrong with a ball glass jar. The problem was the lid. Once you have the silicone seals in place and try to tighten the lid , it basically "cross threads" and comes loose. I don't believe I tried tightening it real tight and mine cross threaded. You could probably charge less and put a ball canning lid on there and for go one of the silicone seals.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Great System for Brewing Cold Brew Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This simple brewing mechanism for cold brew coffee is OUTSTANDING. Made of simple, but high-quality components, the cold brew coffee it produces is perfect. I have several complements from people on both the taste and quality of the cold brew. The Mason jar is very sturdy and the mesh is metal-strong, with very fine mesh. Best of all--everything is dishwasher safe. Excellent product which yields perfect cold brew coffee!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawg72

customer_reviews.title: It’s huge!!!! Love my cold brew on hot Florida days
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this. Makes the beat cold brew ever!! So glad I found this once u start making it u will be come addicted to cold brew. It’s highly concentrated when u make it. This jar makes approximately 1 gallon when u add the rest of you ingredients. I use 1 can of sweetened condensed milk, 1/2 gallon of coconut milk (I use about half) regular milk, creamer if want for extra flavor and I top it off with splashes of Mexican vanilla. Mix all this in an empty milk jug and BOOM!! Like I said it’s highly concentrated so one cup has more caffeine than regular brewed coffee.
customer_reviews.author: AMBER HARTMAN

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cold brew kit and company!
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much! They make cold brewing SO easy and efficient and as a result I've started making so much coffee I don't have room in fridge haha. The parts themselves are very easy to clean with soap and water. I let them air dry after I'm done. I had a very slight issue with the filter and contacted the company. They were beyond helpful and amazing to communicate with!! I could not be happier with a product and company! I have 3 of these sets now they are so great. Highly recommend County Line Kitchen!!
customer_reviews.author: AKA

customer_reviews.title: Cold brew is the best way to make coffee...
customer_reviews.text: I kind of regret getting the smaller jar, but besides that, great product. I recommend keeping the jar upside down while it is steeping so to ensure that all of the grounds are completely submerged. One thing I didn't consider when purchasing this was how to "wring" out the liquid that would be stuck in the grounds after it's done. Started pressing it down with an ice scream scoop, seems to work, lol
customer_reviews.author: Demon_Mustang

customer_reviews.title: Saving so much money!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier! I was spending close to 4$ a pop at Starbucks getting a trenta iced coffee. Saw this and hoped I could replicate my drink. Bought some Torani vanilla syrup and I will now be saving a boatload of money because the brewing process is so smooth! I just leave mine out overnight and have two days worth of coffee. After I take out the filter and clean it out and make my once 4$ drink, I put the other half in the fridge. Pretty excited and planning what to do with the money my family will save!
customer_reviews.author: Dairy Donna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for iced Coffee
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love our cold coffee. The cost of a few fast food coffees and its paid for. Easy to use and clean. I even bought the pour top for it and it works great once the coffee is in the fridge. We buy our coffee in bulk at Costco and Sams Club and gring it in store to the perfect grit for iced coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I received the item before its due date and it's exceeded our expectations. It's easy to use, easy to clean and it makes delicious coffee. I can't believe that I've lived as many years as I have (over 50) without owning something like this sooner. I can't recommend it highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: KlezKen

customer_reviews.title: I decided to go with this one and was not disappointed. The filter is very sturdy and I used ...
customer_reviews.text: After researching all of the different cold brew coffee makers, I decided to go with this one and was not disappointed. The filter is very sturdy and I used regular grounded coffee (not coarse), and was amazed that barely any grounds went through while brewing. The little bit that did settled on the bottom. The lid and seals worked very well, and the coffee tastes great. This is a great deal and I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Neal

customer_reviews.title: Still experimenting with it...
customer_reviews.text: I'm the only coffee drinker in my home so I cut the recipe in half but then the water doesn't full cover the grounds. Still haven't figured out a way around this. I tried swirling the jar every few hours (too much work). I tried storing it upside down (wishful thinking). I tried putting grounds and water in the jar and then pouring it through the filter after steeping (defeats the purpose). Although it is a nice jar for storing your precious cold brew afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Y

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Cold Brew, Smooth and High In Caffeine
customer_reviews.text: Delicious, easy to use. Great instructions. Remember to only use the upper (large) filter when storing brewed coffee without the filter unit. I recommend getting an extra 64oz mason jar for brewed coffee so brewing can continue before all of the brew is consumed. Filter usually only needs to be sprayed off in-between brew cycles. Wash filter in dishwasher versus hand wash occasionally and if storing brew unit. Recommend light and medium roast coffees to maximize caffeine (darker roast = less caffeine).
customer_reviews.author: MCote

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the one quart jar
customer_reviews.text: I have tried out many different cold brew containers including ones with plastic housing. The mason jars are the best, due their strong glass construction, but are not without their problems. Pros: Strong glass, odour-free Very easy to clean; dishwasher friendly Usable as regular Mason jar Cons: The silicon seal sticks; the jar is difficult to reopen The metal mesh filter is not fine enough; plenty of residue left in the cold brew The 2 pint is too large for easy handling. I have large hands and found it unwieldy I would still recommend this cold brew maker, the one pint version. All in, it tastes great in the glass jar!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Can't get enough!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I bought this because I was looking for a cold brewer and didn't want yet another appliance on my counter top. The coffee tastes absolutely delicious. The only problem I have is keeping up with the demand for cold brew coffee in my house. I will probably buy a second. Also a great gift idea.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only made 1 batch so far, but i’m pretty happy with the results. The strainer is very sturdy and really fine, so only a little bit of super fine coffe particles makes it through. Do keep in mind that the most concentrated weight ratio (water:coffee) i got was 11.5:1, i completely filled the strainer and put in 1.5 liters. Depending on where you research, they will suggest 6:1, but then will need to be watered down when you drink it. 11.5:1 can be drank straigh, but will be a strong coffee. I’ve also tried 15:1 which is good regular strength coffee and can be drank without haveing to be watered down.
customer_reviews.author: terrence yao

customer_reviews.title: arived quickly, preforms as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: this makes great tea and is easy to clean. the lid may seem like it fits weird at first, but its definitely water tight, the infusing column is very large, enough for adding in slices of lemon, whole sprigs of herbs, or other large things you could stick in tea. i havent made coffee in it yet, but so far it surpasses expectations, i will buy again...
customer_reviews.author: Vince Coghlan

customer_reviews.title: Lots of sludge and be careful with cap
customer_reviews.text: This worked okay. The coffee was good but I felt it let too much coffee sludge thru the filter. Also, be really careful with the threading on the metal screw top. The first time I used it I thought I had it on right and when I went to shake the bottle like they recommend in the instructions I ended up pulling the top right off and got coffee grounds and water all over my kitchen. I guess that was my fault though. However, the original caps the Ball jars come with don’t seem to have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cold brew maker
customer_reviews.text: For how simple this thing is, it's amazing how good the end result is. We are coffee fanatics in our household and have recently switched to cold brew for the summer time. I purchased this along with a flip top wide mouth lid. Its the perfect setup to leave in your fridge. Its very low maintenance, super simple to use, and makes a great cold brew. It also makes great loose leaf iced tea. Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: stephen c schwochow

customer_reviews.title: Easy at home Cold Brew
customer_reviews.text: If you want to make your own cold brew at home buy this now. It was easy to set up hust put the filter in the jar, add course ground coffee, add water and wait 24hrs. I have already made my money back when compared to buying an iced coffee daily at Starbucks. Plus I can control the quality. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Statlick

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO CLEAN, saves us so much $$$
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this for quite a while now, and use this every single day. We love cold brew, and trust me in the last I tried to do it myself with a coffee filter and a jug, and I made a huge HUGE mess. THIS is what you need if you want to make it at home. It's easy, and saves us SO much money. The mesh is very easy to clean, we throw it right in the dishwasher and it comes out perfect every time. Absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: JKRed

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I used my cold brew coffee maker for the first time and the finished product was excellent. The brewing process is simple and cleaning is a breeze. My iced coffee was perfect. I used my regular ground coffee. There was no bitter taste and no sediment from the coffee grounds in the jar as the filter is amazing. We have a counter depth fridge so space is a bit more limited but the jar fits very well without taking a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the bigger jar!
customer_reviews.text: It terms of build, this product is very durable but in terms of creating good, strong, cold brew, it really falls short. Maybe I messed up by buying the bigger jar thinking I can still create small batches but like what the other reviewers have said, if you use less water, it won't soak all the coffee grinds. If you soak all the grinds, the drink is too watery. If you like making cold brew in small batches, don't buy the big jar. You're probably better off with cheap nut bags
customer_reviews.author: myn-myn

customer_reviews.title: Love it! My husband laughed when he came into ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My husband laughed when he came into the kitchen and saw me leaning on the counter watching it brew ,Put it in the fridge and wait till tomorrow he said. I was just so excited to receive the coffee brewer.! The results you ask? My very own DELICIOUS Cold Brew coffee ! I LOVE IT ! , I am glad that I ordered the extra jar so I won't run out. They look beautiful as well . They arrived beautifully wrapped. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Muriel

customer_reviews.title: Coffee buzzz
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once so still learning! Need to get the coffee, grind, brew time and dilution right to enjoy my cold brew. I was surprised at how much "sediment" there is even after filtering through a coffee filter. It's very fine, not at all like coffee grounds. So with all this said it's a fine cold brew maker and I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mary V

customer_reviews.title: Makes cold brewing a breeze and cleanup is a snap!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and they make cold brewing a breeze! I just add 3/4 cup of grounds and fill the mason jar up. Let it brew on the counter for a day. Comes out perfect for my taste. I like to drink it black. Cleanup is a snap since all I have to do is pull out the strainer, let the water drop out, then dump the grounds in the trash. I follow-up by rinsing the filter in the sink to remove the leftover grounds. Saves so much time and money. I couldn't recommend it more.
customer_reviews.author: N. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Strainer came apart after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this when I first got it, but after several months the metal mesh detached completely from the rim. Disappointed for the price and all the rave reviews. Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for over a year now and love it. Just recently the lid/lip around the filter came detached from the filter itself. I can still use it, a little messy pulling the filter out. Wondering if anyone else had the same issue?
customer_reviews.author: Workman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good product! It's so simple to use and easy to clean. The real plus about this product is its filter, which doesn't leave coffee grinds to seep through. I have tried other cold brewing pitchers before, but the coffee grinds getting into my coffee was always an issue. Not the case for this product. I would highly recommend! While I have only used it for cold brew coffee I'm going to be trying teas soon.
customer_reviews.author: Angela McNeeley

customer_reviews.title: Quality cold brew.....fast
customer_reviews.text: I have owned another type of cold brewer for about 18 months. I tried this model because my son has one. This one has a larger capacity (2 qt) and works much better much faster. This produces cold-brew as strong as one could ever want, or reduce the strength by reduces the volume of ground coffee. I am very impressed with the design and function. This is a big upgrade to what I had previously.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: As Easy As Can Be (and Built to Last)
customer_reviews.text: I had been successfully brewing cold brew coffee through a more elaborate process: steep in a normal pitcher, pour through a strainer, then finish with a French press. This is 10x easier and makes much better coffee since it does a better job of straining out the grounds. It also looks really well made, so I suspect it will last a long time. 100% satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brickbat70

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why this isn't one of the first if not the first item that shows up for ice coffee makers, its amazing! I'm now saving money and drinking ice coffee to my hearts content and the beauty of this is in the simplicity. If your done trying other fancier methods or fancy looking glass thats thin and breaks easy do yourself a favor and grab one of these... wish I had found this first!
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: Cold Brew only way to go IMHO
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one before and liked it so ordered another one. Unfortunately it was cracked which I did not notice. It was a slow leak. Could not get hold of the seller so I called Amazon and I got a replacement very next day!
customer_reviews.author: Davey

customer_reviews.title: Best Cold Brew System I've tried
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!!!! I like to steep 2c of ground coffee in 8c of water. After 24hrs I decant to a gallon container and add another 8c of water and into the fridge it goes for use all week long. This system is the perfect size and easy to get the grounds out of the filter with a simple tapping motion. Clean up is a snap. Thank you so very much.
customer_reviews.author: Voree

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I like this kit. It is like getting Starbucks coffee at home. The brew is concentrated so you can dilute it to suit your taste. It is bit more hassle and clutter than using the conventional coffee maker, but worth it. My wife and I consume a jar of brew in 2 or 3 days. I give it a 4* rating because I think the kit should include two jars so that one jar can be brewing while the other is consumed. I discovered this after the first use, and had to order the second jar separately.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Makes Excellent Cold Brew with Ease
customer_reviews.text: This product makes great cold brew! The filter is easy to wash, the lid and gaskets that come with it fits airtight enough that I can hear a slight hiss after brewing. Everything included is well-built. I find this much easier to clean than when I used a french press. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pavel

customer_reviews.title: Great cold brew setup!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started cold brewing coffee and absolutely love using this jar and filter setup. I use 1-cup of coarsely ground coffee beans and fill the jar to the brim. I let the coffee "brew" on the countertop for 12-hours or in the refrigerator for up 18-24 hours. It's given me really great results so far!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

product_meta.title: Cold Brew Mason Jar Coffee Maker by County Line Kitchen - 2 Quart, 64 oz – Durable Glass Jar, Heavy Duty Stainless Steel Filter, Stainless Steel Lid, Save $ - Easily Make Your Own Cold Brew
feature_bullets: Effortlessly make delicious cold brew with the amazing County Line Kitchen cold brewer. Simply add coffee, steep overnight and drink. Clean up is quick and simple and all components are dishwasher safe.

You will enjoy our high quality, stainless steel filter. Our filter mesh is super fine to prevent grounds from entering the coffee. The heavy duty mesh in our filters will last a lifetime. Our rolled and folded seam eliminates any sharp edges.

Ball mason jars are made to last and built to withstand the canning process. There is no need to worry about breaking your jar, this heavy duty jar can withstand rough handling. The inert soda lime glass also won’t leach harmful chemicals into your brew.
Safe - No BPA, no plastics. Our brewer’s components are all made of inert, FDA compliant glass, stainless steel and silicone rubber including our stainless steel lid!
You can also cold brew tea and our brewer makes a great infuser too! Infuse water with your favorite fruits or infuse oils with spices or other flavorings!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,074 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
